title: BGB detains 2 associates of a suspected human trafficker in Sherpur
body: Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB) has detained two associates of a suspected human trafficker named Philip from the Baromari border area in Sherpur's Nalitabari upazila. According to a press release signed by Lt Col Md Mehedi Hasan, commanding officer of Mymensingh Battalion (39 BGB), the paramilitary force remains on high alert along the border following the recent shooting of Sharif Osman Hadi. The detainees were identified as Benjamin Chiran, 45, Philip's maternal uncle-in-law, and Sishal, 28, a close friend of Philip. The BGB statement said Philip is accused of assisting people in crossing the border illegally, and the detainees were his accomplices. Earlier, the BGB detained Philip's wife, Delta Chiran, father-in-law Earson Rangdi, and another associate, Luis Lengminja, and handed them over to the police, the press release added.
